summary: Roast your food over the fire without needing a cooking pot.
descriptionHtml:
[size=4][b]What is Roasted Meat?[/b][/size]

Roasted Meat aims at giving Skyrim a little more realism through adding the ability to roast meat over the fire whenever you are near one – without needing a cooking pot.
It also adds a few recipes without the need of salt, so you won't have to starve anymore if you have no salt in your backpack.


[size=4][b]How is that done?[/b][/size]

Once you activate the mod, you will get a power that you can use whenever you stand near an open fire. If you use it, a menu, similar to the cooking menu, will open, but it only contains recipes for food that can be roasted, like meat, leek or potatoes. (and maybe some more in the future)

To keep the menu small, every recipe that only contains meat or meat and salt will only appear if you have all the needed ingredients.

For those who only search for no salt recipes, the old versions are still downloadable under old files. (You will however still need a cooking pot for those)


[size=4][b]Compatibility:[/b][/size]

None of the existing Skyrim recipes are changed, so this mod is compatible with everything that adds or changes them.
It does however only add recipes for the vanilla Skyrim foods.

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26228]Realistic Needs And Diseases:[/url]
This mod was made with Realistic Needs and Diseases in mind so it is fully compatible. Food Spoilage will work with the meat from my mod.
Make sure to load it after Realistic Needs and Diseases!


Thanks to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/8222270/?][b]animegirl12249[/b] [/url]there is now a Combination Pack for compatibility with more mods!
The pack currently contains:
- Roasted Meat for Realistic Needs and Diseases and Frostfall
- Roasted Meat for Realistic Needs and Diseases, Frostfall and Hunterborn

Please feel free to suggest more combinations if there is something the mod should be made compatible with!


[size=4][b]Install:[/b][/size]
Simply merge the data folder with the data folder in your Skyrim directory.
author: Cayce Sianan

files.name: Roasted Meat - Vanilla
files.changelogHtml:
small recipe updates
corrected spelling issues
added compatibility for Realistic Wildlife Loot

files.name: Roasted Meat - RND
files.changelogHtml:
18/02/2014

- updated the mod for the newest version of RND (1.9.10) – food spoilage of RND should now work with the meat of my mod too
- added exact version number to the required files
- removed compatibility with RWL
- corrected some keywords


RND and Realistic Wildlife Loot:
Roasted Meat will no longer support RWL as the compatibility patch has been removed from the RND patch pack. Use „animal loot“ from RND instead – it is an optional file included in the newest RND download.

It might be possible to get older versions of the mods to work together but I wouldn't do that unless you really, really can't play without RWL. I can't tell you wich version you would need to make it work with my mod however as I don't remember which one I used to create Roasted Meat.

RWL:
No Vanilla-RWL file this time. Roasted Meat was created with Realistic Needs and Diseases in mind. Without RND it is nothing more than a little gimmick.
I can add a version for RWL if someone wants it however.

Vanilla:
The old version for vanilla Skyrim is still working, so no changes here.
20/10/2014

- added a "Roasted Meat Combination Pack" that contains compatibility versions for Frostfall and Hunterborn (all credits go to animegirl12249)
